result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher T Dreyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the stipulated amount of $1479.94 to Michael E
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
Pay all court costs
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with the Probation Department including following all rules of probation.
Anger management counseling.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.

timeConds.notes: 30 days in the HOC, stayed and to be used at the PO agents discretion.

records.addlTxt: Case recalled.  Court denies defense request for expungement of this case.

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Michael E.  Court sentenced the defendant to 9 months in the House of Correction straight time with 2 days credit.  Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 year probation.
  Conditions of Probation:
- 30 days in the HOC, stayed and to be used at the PO agents discretion
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department including following all rules of probation
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 50 hours of community service
- anger management counseling
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the stipulated amount of $1479.94 to Michael E
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
Pay all court costs
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


Filed:  
Restitution worksheet
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Documents of support for the defendant

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher T Dreyer
Current: 14530 W Meadowshire Drive, New Berlin, WI 53151 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2015)
Prior: 5253 North Lovers Lane Road #212, Milwaukee, WI 53225

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Amended Information filed.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information, waived its reading and intends to enter  plea of guilty on today.  

Charge amended to MISDEMEANOR BATTERY, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor

COUNT 1 AS AMENDED:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court reminds defendant of No Contact order.  Case adjourned before Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Parties have reached a resolution.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on the same date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case in court for final pre-trial.  State recites its final offer on the record. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 19.   Court adjourns the 9/23/15 jury trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

received and filed with
   - Defendant's Motions in Limine
   - Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford via telephone.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mark Peterson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.E., C.P., or Apt #3 at 5253 N Lovers Lane Road.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in court with attorney Paul S. Crawford.  Defendant Christopher T Dreyer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
